data.name: Monitor iOS App Store Reviews & Send Email Notifications Automatically

parameters.content: **Runs every 6 hours to check for new reviews - adjust timing based on your monitoring needs**
**Set your App Store ID, country (us/gb/de), and language (en/es/fr) - find App ID in your App Store URL**
**Calls Apple's iTunes API to get latest customer reviews - sorted by most recent first**
**Compares with last check time to find only NEW reviews since previous run - prevents duplicate notifications**

parameters.message: =🆕 New iOS App Store Review (⭐ {{$json.rating}}/5) “{{$json.title}}” by {{$json.author}} — v{{$json.version}} — {{$json.content}}
parameters.subject: =New App Store Review (⭐ {{$json.rating}}/5) — {{$json.title}}

text_content.all_text:
Schedule Trigger
Extract Reviews
true
false
Any new reviews?
App Config
manual
Fetch Reviews
Filter latest Review

Runs every 6 hours to check for new reviews - adjust timing based on your monitoring needs

Set your App Store ID, country (us/gb/de), and language (en/es/fr) - find App ID in your App Store URL

Calls Apple’s iTunes API to get latest customer reviews - sorted by most recent first

Compares with last check time to find only NEW reviews since previous run - prevents duplicate notifications

Send notification
send: message
False Case
manual

text_blocks.text: Runs every 6 hours to check for new reviews - adjust timing based on your monitoring needs
Set your App Store ID, country (us/gb/de), and language (en/es/fr) - find App ID in your App Store URL
Calls Apple’s iTunes API to get latest customer reviews - sorted by most recent first
Compares with last check time to find only NEW reviews since previous run - prevents duplicate notifications
I can answer most questions about building workflows in n8n.
For specific tasks, you’ll see the Ask Assistant button in the UI.

You can then press delete to remove it or press escape to cancel. text_blocks.text: Runs every 6 hours to check for new reviews - adjust timing based on your monitoring needs
Set your App Store ID, country (us/gb/de), and language (en/es/fr) - find App ID in your App Store URL
